text: I use vivaldi

- gesture navigation
- Tab groups
- fixed panel/tabs
- more than one tab opened on the same windows (similar than have more than one window but better)
- Chromium based, so you can use Chrome extensions :slightly_smiling_face:
does HubSpot use special tactics / technologies that Opera is not supporting?
Can be styling issue in interface or js compatibility issue
I think it's simply that they don't want to officially support a browser that has very low marketshare
In my use of it it works as well as chrome. Opera is chromium based so it makes sense
<https://www.businessinsider.com.au/amazon-system-automatically-fires-warehouse-workers-time-off-task-2019-4?r=US&IR=T>
that is pretty crazy in my opinion..

agreed. we just briefly talked about it at my office. We’re all in agreement - it’s fine to have AI monitor and analyze employee productivity, but actually pulling the trigger on firing a person is not okay to us. There can be tons of reasons a person isn’t performing well in productivity metrics that the AI can’t take into account
agreed - its just inhumane
first the stock market, now employees
I’m dying to see this! All the tickets were sold out when I looked for them last week!

<@UBT0AHWLD> <@UFYB4S8LU> For a company/product that I love and use almost daily, this is the kind of news that leaves such a bad taste in my mouth.  I get that with such scale these sorts of “innovations” seem necessary, but at what point is a line drawn in the sand when it comes to humanity in the workplace.

we’re starting to border on what the show “Travelers” dabbled with - but on a corporate level.
(background: Travelers is about time travelers sent from the future to modern day and the past, to try to make small changes to the timeline to prevent climate change and other negative problems from causing the version of the future the travelers are from. The travelers are sent by an AI which is directing the people in what to do, choosing who lives who dies. Basically the AI is playing God.)
Totally!  For as seemingly crazy the concept is for that show, it’s quite good. But I’m a bit of a scifi nerd.
i agree, great concept. The actual show - not as interesting as the concept I felt
anyone have any experience buying a domain that is private? (not from a registrar) and did you use some type of person? Like is that a domain buying consultant or brokerage out there?
I haven’t done it personally but yes there are apparently domain escrow services

I don’t know fully how it works, had a friend tell me about it. Basically what he explained is the seller gives the escrow company access to the domain. The buyer pays the escrow company, the escrow company  gives access to the domain only after purchase, and cuts off access to the domain from the seller.

Something like that. basically protects both parties
The Escrow service also communicates with the domain registrars the seller and buyer are using to facilitate it.
thanks Jon!
